alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 5:40AM MDT until June 23 at 1:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. For the Wind River Basin...including Red Creek, Dubois, Crowheart, Kinnear, Riverton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring, including around the Wind River Bridge on Highway 132 near Kinnear. * WHERE...Wind River near Kinnear. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor agricultural flooding along right bank. Water begins to move towards low areas north of Highway 132. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Agricultural flooding along both banks becomes more widespread and intensifies. Water begins to encroach the north end of Highway 132. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM MDT the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain in or near flood stage through Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM MDT.
